title: Emma Thompson speaks of sadness that George Michael never got to see Last Christmas film
text:
Dame Emma Thompson has spoken of her sadness that the singer-songwriter George Michael never got to see the feature film on which they had been collaborating before his sudden death aged just 53.

The film, which is released in November, takes its name from the pop superstar’s classic hit, Last Christmas, one of the most-loved Christmas songs of all time. It will feature 15 of his songs, including a new one that he had composed for the production before his death on Christmas Day 2016.

It is a romantic comedy with serious themes, including the rise in homelessness and the “demonisation” of migrants. In between other projects, Thompson and her husband, fellow actor Greg Wise, had spent seven years working on its screenplay.

The Oscar-winning actress told The Telegraph: “One of the saddest things about this film taking quite this long was that George died… It would have been so wonderful had he been around, because… he was very passionate, particularly about the issue of homelessness… We’ve [had] wonderful access to his work.”

She added: “It’s music that he wrote for the film which is very spooky and spookily-apt because the screenplay wasn’t quite finished when he was writing it. But he knew what the story was… So it’s a very interesting marriage of ideas and music.”
